markers.description: DESCRIBED BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1923 ON THE WESTERN PART OF A FLAT ISOLATED TABLE OF THE HILL KNOWN LOCALLY AS 70-MILE BUTTE.  THE STATION MAY BE REACHED FROM THE SMITH AND SAMMONS RANCH BY GOING 1 MILE WEST, 100 METERS SOUTH, AND ONE-FOURTH MILE WEST OVER A GOOD TRAIL.  THENCE OVER A LITTLE-USED TRAIL SOUTH THROUGH A BARNYARD.  FOR ONE-HALF MILE AROUND THE WEST END OF A SLOUGH.  AND THENCE ABOUT 1 MILE IN A SOUTHERLY DIRECTION UP TO A TABLELAND.  FROM THIS POINT THE ROUTE LIES FIRST SOUTHEAST PAST A LARGE BOULDER AND OVER A BREAK, AND THENCE SOUTH AND WEST, AS FAR AS POSSIBLE FOLLOWING A HOGBACK TO THE FLAT ISOLATED TABLE.  THE STATION IS NEAR THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH SIDE OF SECTION 11, T. 3, R. 13 W., THIRD MERIDIAN.  THE SUBSURFACE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK 3 INCHES IN DIAMETER, STAMPED GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA TRIANGULATION STATION, SET IN THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF A RECTANGULAR BLOCK OF CONCRETE 1 FOOT 6 INCHES SQUARE AND 2 FEET HIGH.  THE BASE OF THE BLOCK IS 6 FEET UNDERGROUND.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A LIKE BRONZE DISK SET IN THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF A BLOCK OF CONCRETE 1 FOOT 6 INCHES SQUARE AT THE BASE, 1 FOOT SQUARE AT THE TOP, AND 5 FEET 6 INCHES HIGH.  THE BASE OF THIS UPPER BLOCK OF CONCRETE RESTS UPON THE TOP OF THE SUBSURFACE BLOCK, SEPARATED FROM IT BY A SHEET OF TARRED PAPER.  THE TOP OF THE UPPER BLOCK PROJECTS 1 FOOT 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE SURFACE MARK IS CENTERED VERTICALLY OVER THE SUBSURFACE MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1922)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1922 TIES WERE MADE TO IBC CONTROL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (WRP) THIS STATION WAS NOT VISITED BY AN OBSERVING PARTY, BUT WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION BY A LIGHTKEEPER.  A FOUR-FOOT STAND WAS ERECTED.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY ENERGY MINES AND RESOURCES 1999 THE STATION IS LOCATED 8 KM (4.95 MI) NORTH OF MAPLE CREEK ALONG HIGHWAY 21.  FROM THE INTERSECTION OF THE TRANS CANADA HIGHWAYS 1 AND 21, DRIVE NORTH ALONG HIGHWAY 21 FOR 0.6 KM (0.35 MI) TO A DRIVEWAY. TURN IN A WESTERLY DIRECTION FOR 348 M (1141.7 FT) AT THE JUNCTION. THE PILLAR IS 1.0 M (3.3 FT) AWAY FROM A WIRE FENCE AND ABOUT 9.0 M (29.5 FT) FROM THE CENTER OF THE DIRT TRAIL.  THE PILLAR IS PAINTED GREEN AND SITUATED ON ROAD ALLOWANCE NORTH BOUNDARY OF NORTHEAST SECTION 10, TOWNSHIP 12, RANGE 26, WEST OF THIRD MERIDIAN.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STAINLESS STEEL PLATE WITH A FORCED CENTERING THREADED BOLT EMBEDDED IN A 30 CM IN DIAMETER CONCRETE PILLAR THAT IS 5 M (16.4 FT) IN LENGTH.  THE TOP OF PILLAR PROJECTS 1.32 M (4.33 FT) ABOVE GROUND.  THERE IS A NAME PLATE AFFIXED ON THE SIDE OF THE PILLAR AS WELL AS THE BENCH MARK BOLT, AND ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE, AN EYE BOLT TO CHAIN A SECURITY BOX TO THE PILLAR.
markers.setting: undefinedUNSPECIFIED SETTING
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY ENERGY MINES AND RESOURCES 1994 THIS IS A CANADIAN CBN POINT USED IN A SURVEY BY THE INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION. FOR INFORMATION ON LOCATION OR USE CONTACT THE CANADIAN GEODETIC SURVEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1999)  RECOVERY NOTE BY ENERGY MINES AND RESOURCES 1999 THE STATION IS LOCATED WEST OF ASSINIBOIA.  FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 SOUTH AND 13 WEST, DRIVE WEST ALONG HIGHWAY 13 FOR 1.6 KM (1.00 MI) TO A DIRT ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH FOR 1.0 KM (0.60 MI) ON THE DIRT ROAD.  THE PAINTED GREEN PILLAR IS ON THE RIGHT SIDE (WEST) ABOUT 11.0 M (36.1 FT) FROM THE CENTERLINE.  SITUATED ON ROAD ALLOWANCE ALONG THE EAST BOUNDARY OF SECTION 11, TOWNSHIP 8, RANGE 1 WEST OF THE THIRD MERIDIAN.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STAINLESS STEEL PLATE WITH A FORCED CENTERING THREADED BOLT EMBEDDED IN A 30 CM IN DIAMETER CONCRETE PILLAR WHICH IS 5 M (16.4 FT) IN LENGTH AND PROJECTS 1.29 M (4.23 FT) ABOVE GROUND.  THERE IS A NAME PLATE AFFIXED ON THE SIDE OF THE PILLAR AS WELL AS A BENCH MARK BOLT, AND ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE, AN EYE BOLT TO CHAIN A SECURITY BOX TO THE PILLAR.
markers.setting: undefinedUNSPECIFIED SETTING
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1922 IN NW 1/4 SEC. 3, T. 1, R. 14 W., THIRD MERIDIAN.  ON TOP OF A HIGH ROUNDED BUTTE.  THE SUBSURFACE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK 3 INCHES IN DIAMETER, STAMPED GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA TRIANGULATION STATION, SET IN THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF A RECTANGULAR BLOCK OF CONCRETE 1 FOOT 6 INCHES SQUARE AND 2 FEET HIGH.  THE BASE OF THE BLOCK IS 6 FEET UNDERGROUND.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A LIKE BRONZE DISK SET IN THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF A BLOCK OF CONCRETE 1 FOOT 6 INCHES SQUARE AT THE BASE, 1 FOOT SQUARE AT THE TOP, AND 5 FEET 6 INCHES HIGH.  THE BASE OF THIS UPPER BLOCK OF CONCRETE RESTS UPON THE TOP OF THE SUBSURFACE BLOCK, SEPARATED FROM IT BY A SHEET OF TARRED PAPER.  THE TOP OF THE UPPER BLOCK PROJECTS 1 FOOT 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE SURFACE MARK IS CENTERED VERTICALLY OVER THE SUBSURFACE MARK.  THE REFERENCE MARK IS A DOMINION LANDS SURVEY POST AT THE CENTER OF THE WEST SIDE OF SEC. 3, T. 1, R. 14 W., 558.35 METERS FROM THE STATION S 14 DEG 18 MIN W.                            STATION RECOVERY (1922)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1922 IN NW 1/4 SECTION 3, TOWNSHIP 1, RANGE 14 W, THIRD MERIDIAN, ON TOP OF A HIGH ROUNDED BUTTE.  STATION MARK--A STANDARD GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA STATION MARK. THE REFERENCE MARK IS A DOMINION LANDS SURVEY POST AT THE CENTER OF THE WEST SIDE OF SECTION 3, TOWNSHIP 1, RANGE 14 W, 558.35 METERS FROM THE STATION IN BEARING 14 DEGREES 17 MINUTES 35 SECONDS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (WRP) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY THE GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA IN 1922.  A REVISED DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A HIGH, ROUNDED, AND GRASS-COVERED HILL IN THE NORTHWEST QUARTER SECTION 3, T. 1, R. 14 W. AND IS ON LAND BELONGING TO THE CANADIAN GOVERNMENT. IT IS 0.9 MILE NORTH OF THE INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE DOMINION OF CANADA, 1.1 MILES EAST OF SASKATCHEWAN HIGHWAY 4, AND ABOUT 20 MILES SOUTH OF VALMARIE.  THE STATION MARK PROJECTS 12 INCHES AND IS 0.1 MILE EAST OF A NORTH-AND-SOUTH FENCE AND 0.2 MILE SOUTH OF AN EAST-AND-WEST FENCE.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE G.S. OF CANADA STATION MARK AND IS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS STAMPED, MONCHY, G.S. OF C. 1934.  IT PROJECTS 9 INCHES AND IS SOUTHWEST OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS STAMPED, MONCHY, G.S. OF C. 1934.  IT IS NORTHWEST OF THE STATION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE STATION.  IT IS STAMPED, MONCHY, G.S. OF C. 1934 AND PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  IT IS 3 FEET SOUTH OF AN EAST-AND-WEST FENCE AND 78 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF SECTION 3.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE U.S. CUSTOMS HOUSE, 55.6 MILES VIA THE D-Y TRAIL NORTH OF MALTA, MONTANA, GO NORTH FROM THE CUSTOMS HOUSE 0.9 MILE ON SASKATCHEWAN HIGHWAY 4 TO MR. JAMES HOUSE AND FARM BUILDINGS 0.1 MILE EAST OF THE HIGHWAY.  GO EAST FROM THE HOUSE, PASSING BETWEEN RED BARN AND HAY PEN, PASS THROUGH TWO GATES AND GO EAST ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF AN EAST-AND-WEST FENCE 0.9 MILE TO A FENCE CORNER.  (THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 78 FEET WEST OF THIS CORNER).  HERE TURN SOUTH ALONG WEST SIDE OF NORTH-AND-SOUTH FENCE AND GO 0.2 MILE.  TAKE DOWN FENCE TURN LEFT (EAST) AND GO 0.1 MILE TO TOP OF HIGHEST HILL AND STATION.  A 4-FOOT STAND WILL CLEAR ALL LINES FROM THIS STATION.  HOWEVER A 15-FOOT STAND IS NECESSARY IN ORDER TO ELIMINATE A GRAZING LINE TO STATION PLAINSVIEW.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1923 ABOUT 14 MILES SOUTH AND 1 MILE WEST OF THE TOWN OF CONSUL, SASKATCHEWAN, AND ABOUT 7 MILES NORTH OF THE INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY.  THE STATION IS ON THE HIGH GROUND, ABOUT 50 METERS EAST AND 25 METERS SOUTH OF SECTION POST 4-2-27, AND ABOUT 25 METERS EAST OF PLAIN ROAD LEADING FROM CONSUL INTO MONTANA. THE STATION IS IN THE NORTHWEST QUARTER OF SECTION 3, TOWNSHIP 2 N, RANGE 27 W.                            STATION RECOVERY (1949)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1949 (MJT) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DESCRIPTION TO REACH THE STATION IS ADEQUATE WITH THE EXCEPTION THAT A NEW CUSTOM HOUSE AT THE CANADIAN BOUNDARY HAS BEEN BUILT AND IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.5 MILES NORTH OF THE OLD WILLOW CREEK STATION OF THE CANADIAN CUSTOMS.  AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET 0.2 MILE SOUTH OF THE STATION. IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NASHLIN 1949 SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK, AND IS ABOUT 6 FEET WEST OF A DIM TRACK ROAD.  THIS STATION WAS NOT OCCUPIED BY AN OBSERVING PARTY AND THE RECOVERY NOTE IS WRITTEN FROM INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THE BUILDING PARTY AND THE LIGHTKEEPER WHO ACTUALLY VISITED THE STATION.

DESCRIBED BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1923 ABOUT 24 MILES SOUTH AND 18 MILES WEST OF EAST END, SASKATCHEWAN, AND 12 MILES NORTH OF THE INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY. REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD CANADIAN GEODETIC SURVEY BRONZE-DISK REFERENCE MARK SET IN A SQUARE BLOCK OF CONCRETE 22.09 METERS FROM THE STATION S 03 DEG 02 MIN E.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A LIKE BRONZE DISK SET IN A SIMILAR MANNER 22.71 METERS FROM THE STATION N 88 DEG 04 MIN W.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY ENERGY MINES AND RESOURCES 1994 THIS STATION IS A CANADIAN CBN POINT USED IN AN INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION SURVEY. FOR INFORMATION ON THIS STATION CONTACT THE CANADIAN GEODETIC SURVEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1999)  RECOVERY NOTE BY ENERGY MINES AND RESOURCES 1999 TO REACH FROM REGINA, PROCEED EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 1 FOR 15 KM (9.30 MI) TO THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 48 AT WHITE CITY.  THEN TRAVEL SOUTHEASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 48 FOR 16 KM (9.95 MI) TO THE INTERSECTION OF GRID ROAD 621.  TURN SOUTH ON THE GRID ROAD FOR 9.8 KM (6.10 MI) TO THE INTERSECTION WITH AN EAST-WEST GRAVEL ROAD.  THEN PROCEED WESTERLY ALONG A GRAVEL ROAD FOR ABOUT 3.2 KM (2.00 MI) TO WHERE THE ROAD CURVES SOUTH.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ALONG A TRAIL FOR 100 M (328.1 FT). THE STATION CAN ALSO BE REACHED FROM REGINA BY PROCEEDING SOUTHEASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 33 FOR 24 KM (14.90 MI) TO THE ORGANIZED HAMLET OF KRONAU.  PROCEED EAST ON THE PAVED ROAD TO THE OYAMA LAKE REGIONAL PARK APPROXIMATELY 5 KM (3.10 MI).  FOLLOW THE ROAD AROUND THE LAKE UNTIL THE FOURTH CURVE WHERE YOU CONTINUE ALONG A TRAIL (LEADING NORTH) STRAIGHT.  PILLAR IS 100 M (328.1 FT) FROM THE START OF THE TRAIL.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STAINLESS STEEL PLATE WITH A FORCED CENTERING THREADED BOLT EMBEDDED IN A 30 CM IN DIAMETER AND 5 M (16.4 FT) IN LENGTH CONCRETE PILLAR PROJECTING 1.5 M (4.9 FT) ABOVE GROUND.  THERE IS A NAME PLATE AFFIXED TO THE SIDE OF THE PILLAR AS WELL AS A BENCH MARK BOLT, AND ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE, AN EYE BOLT TO CHAIN A SECURITY BOX TO THE PILLAR.
markers.setting: undefinedUNSPECIFIED SETTING
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1924 ON A VERY PROMINENT KNOLL KNOWN LOCALLY AS SCOUT HILL ABOUT 2 MILES NORTHWEST OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTHGATE, NORTH DAKOTA, IN NW 1/4 SEC. 12, T. 1, R. 3 W., SECOND MERIDIAN.  STATION MARK--A STANDARD GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA STATION MARK. SEE PAGE 1.  THE REFERENCE MARKS ARE DOMINION LANDS SURVEY POSTS, ONE AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF SEC. 12, T. 1, R. 3 W., 1,300.8 METERS FROM STATION N 68 DEG 14 MIN E, THE SECOND AT THE CENTER OF THE EAST SIDE OF THE SAME SECTION, 1,250.26 METERS FROM THE STATION S 75 DEG 04 MIN E.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (RAM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE NOT RECOVERED AS THEY COULD NOT BE FOUND BY THE OBSERVING PARTY.  A NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2 MILES NORTHWEST OF THE SMALL VILLAGE OF NORTHGATE NORTH DAKOTA.  IT IS ON THE SUMMIT OF A PROMINENT KNOLL JUST NORTH OF A KNOLL THAT IS LOCALLY KNOWN AS SCOUT HILL.  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 FEET AND THE DISK IS A STANDARD GEODETIC SURVEY DISK OF CANADA.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE UNITED STATES - CANADA BORDER LINE WHICH IS JUST NORTH OF THE SMALL VILLAGE OF NORTHGATE NORTH DAKOTA, GO WEST AND NORTH ON MAIN TRAVELED GRAVELED ROAD FOR 1.7 MILES TO A FARM ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO WEST FOR 0.3 MILE TO FARM YARD, THENCE TURN RIGHT ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF FENCE LINE FOR 0.4 MILE, THENCE GO NORTHWEST ON TRACK ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE, THENCE TURN LEFT AND GO 0.1 MILE TO THE SUMMIT OF THE HILL AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  OBSERVATIONS WERE TAKEN FROM A FOUR FOOT WOOD STAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION 1966 (WRH) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

THE STATION IS ON TOP OF A KNOLL ABOUT 125 METERS WEST OF THE HIGHEST POINT ON A ROAD BETWEEN SECS. 27 AND 28 WHERE IT TURNS TO THE EAST AROUND THE KNOLL. THE REFERENCE MARK IS A DOMINION LANDS SURVEY POST AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE ABOVE SECTION, 96.95 METERS FROM THE STATION N 55 DEG 39 MIN E.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION 1923 THIS STATION WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA.  TIES WERE MADE TO THE IBC CONTROL.

THE REFERENCE MARK IS A DOMINION LANDS SURVEY POST AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE ABOVE SECTION, 345.03 METERS FROM THE STATION N 75 DEG 26 MIN E.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION 1923 THIS STATION WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA.  TIES WERE MADE TO THE IBC CONTROL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1923 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1988)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1988 THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 25.3 KM (15.70 MI) NORTH OF WESTBY, MONTANA, 20.1 KM (12.50 MI) NORTHWEST OF THE FORTUNA, NORTH DAKOTA - TORQUAY, SASKATCHEWAN BORDER CROSSING, AND ABOUT 6.8 KM (4.25 MI) SOUTH OF BAUBIER, SASKATCHEWAN.  FOR PERMISSION AND DIRECTIONS TO THE STATION CONTACT -MR. ELDEN LOHSE- BOX 40, BAUBIER, SASKATCHEWAN SOC OHO, PHONE 306-447-4903. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE RAILROAD CROSSING AT THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE SMALL TOWN OF BAUBIER, GO SOUTH ON PROVINCIAL ROAD 707, GRAVEL, FOR 4.0 KM (2.50 MI) TO A GRAVEL CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON THE GRAVEL ROAD FOR 3.4 KM (2.10 MI) TO A GRAVEL SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON THE GRAVEL ROAD FOR 1.65 KM (1.05 MI) TO A DRIVEWAY ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON THE DRIVEWAY FOR 0.24 KM (0.15 MI) TO THE FARMHOUSE OF MR. ELDEN LOHSE. CONTINUE WEST ON A TRACK ROAD AROUND THE NORTH SIDE OF HIS HOUSE AND A MACHINE SHED FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE HIGHEST PART OF A SMALL RISE. THE STATION MARK HAS NO STAMPING. TYPED BY E.A.R.
